Description: it runs north/south and the school is to the west. in the morning the street is the greyest gloomiest place on earth, after 15:30 it's a brightly lit golden pathway to freedom and happiness.

Name: entrance hall
Description: exhibits all the pomp and circumstance required to lull parents into a false belief that the school is being run in a professional way. the cracks are showing and it is not as well maintained as the public façade outside. celebrations of current locale festivals adorn the walls with endless contributions from pupils.

Name: corridor of gloom
Description: a horrific sense of dread overwhelms you as there is very little natural ligh heret. it's the central hub of paths behind the entrance hall but it's forebodingness sums up the remainder of the school accurately.
Help: go towards the light, although not metaphorically!

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: you ascend the down-leg stairs and end up directly above where you started.

Name: east toilets
Description: a very unpleasant place to be; most of the stall are broken and don't have locks or even doors, the remaining stalls are soiled beyond what is believable. there is a row of thankfully clean hand basins half of which have working taps.
Help: there is a plentiful supply of water in the toilets.

Name: assembly hall
Description: the hub of school assembly, both for internal curiculum activities and also for the wider community. the hall hosts everything from morning assembly, music concerts, dramatic performances for pupils to being ballet voting and bingo sessions for the locals.

Name: stage
Description: the secondary focal point of the school, anything of consequence usually happens here or is at least announced here. the stage is made up from rough, dusty floorboards which creak endlessly when walking across them. the stage is surrounded by ancient curtains that are equally dusty.
Help: remember to project your voice and speak from the diaphragm.

Conditions.FailResponse: it is very dark under the stage, it would be unwise to go down there without being able to see anything.

Name: main store room
Description: it has a musty smell and is lined by rows of freestanding shelving units. unsurprisingly it is full of school antiquites most of which look like they haven't been used in decades and are unfamiliar to you.

Name: administration office
Description: possibly the most efficient room in the entire school. filing cabinets line all the walls and above them shelves are stacked end-to-end with ring-bound folders.
Help: every single record on every single pupil is stored in this room.

Name: headmaster's office
Description: the most intimidating room in the entire school. despite the school headmaster effectively being the veo of the school he still likes to medal in individual pupil disciplinaries. the walls are faded cream and all the woodwork is very aged, the only thing that looks modern is the numerous certificates and citations frames and hung on the walls.

Name: east canteen
Description: contains not enough seating for the amassed pupils, so a shift pattern is employed to ensure all pupils get to enjoy the experience on a daily basis.
Help: the east canteen is overflowing with vanity.
State: it is packed with popular boys and girls, everyone is doing their best to out-dress each other like strutting peacocks in an attempt to become the alpha male or female.

Name: west canteen
Description: this west end of the canteen is filled mostly with hot food counters and a queuing serpentine made from very study railing. the smell of food in unavailable although it is not appealing.
Help: bringing your own fruit for lunch may be more desirable that school dinners

Name: under the stage
Description: this is the most bizarre place in the school. although accessible via a trapdoor in the stage the stage basement is latticed with rough-wood support beam and everything is layered with deep dust. the atmosphere here has more drama than has ever been seen on the stage.

Name: back stage
Description: as old and rough as the rest of the stage, although it is a clear indication of academic and social divide; anyone without enough academic acumen to be teacher's pet is doomed to only ever become a behind-the-scenes stage hand in any school productions.

Name: gym
Description: a large hall with a shiny parquet floor covered with different court markings. bandminton, tennis, netball, five-a-side football and basketball courts can be made out, but the others are a mystery.

Name: gym changing room
Description: as basic as any room can be, bare walls and brown tiled floor. even the wooden-slat benches are utilitarion with grey metal hanging pegs. there are no soft furnishings for any odour to cling to.
Help: your privates are not private here

Name: showers
Description: the open showers resemble nothing other than prison showers and not a nice prison - a really, really bad one. no shower in the world is as grim as this place.
Help: the showers may clearn your body but your soul will be scarred for life if you stay too long here.

Name: kitchen
Description: large on an industrial scale; the floor is covered in utilitarian tiles and over-sized cooking utilis hang around the room above oversides sinks and cookers - even the suppliest are oversized ro cater for all the pupils and staff. it has a perma-small of cooked food.
Help: you aren't allowed in the kitchen.

Name: music room
Description: it is unique in that it feels less like an academic classroom than any other room in the school. it is twice the size of other classroms and filled with more instruments than chairs and desks.
Help: the music room is by far the loudest room in the school and the only room where you won't be punished for making noise.

Name: bins
Description: this area contains a colleciton of large galvanized steel cylindrical bins on wheels. most of the bins are covered but one has no lid, the stench from it is repugnant so it's advisable not to linger here too long.
Help: where there's muck there's brass.

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: you take a run-up at the bin and managed to get enough of a grip on the rim and traction from your shoes to clear the top.

Name: binside
Description: inside the bin smells even worse than outside, but be thankful that you have entered the right-way-up, unlike many previous unwilling visitors!  you are standing on rubbish which is many feet deep, but at least this will allow you to exist easily.
Help: binside is a portmanteau of bin and inside.

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: you climb out of the bin and your nose thanks you.

State: the smell is offensive.

Name: bike sheds
Description: the bike sheds are filled with a variety of bicycles, from racers to bmxs and shoppers to choppers. they are all dilligently locked up as a bike is usually the most expensive item a school pupil owns.
Help: to get home you will need your bike.

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: although there isn't much room you squeeze between the end of the bike covered racks and the overgrown shrubbery.

Name: behind the bike sheds
Description: the most illicit area in the school, the name alone is synonmous with unauthorised acitivitys from heavy petting to smoking. as if further proof is needed the ground is littered with cigarette butts.
Help: like in prison, cigarettes can be used as currency in school.

Name: covered path
Description: main throroughfare through the school, joiing the front of the building to the back, while avoiding all classroms and offices inbetween. although outdoors the path is covered with a clear plastic canopy which allows dry passage during the rain.

Name: physics lab
Description: filled with old-fasioned fixed benches in ranks lined with high bar-like stools. this allows gas and water supplies to the benches to facilitates experiments. it still retains old-fashioned blackboards at the front of the lab. this lab is distinct for its view over the school's science courtyard, kind of like a blue peter garden but of course off-limits to pupils.

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: you climb out through the open window, hoping that no-one in authority sees you.

Name: chemistry lab
Description: filled with old-fasioned fixed benches in ranks lined with high bar-like stools. this allows gas and water supplies to the benches to facilitates chemical experiments. it still retains old-fashioned blackboards at the front of the lab.

Name: science store room
Description: separates the biology and chemistry labs with access doors leading to each. this room is often frequented by biology and chemistry teachers during lessons and houses all the supplies needed for science lessons - it's a treasure trove of dangerous chemicals!

Name: biology lab
Description: filled with old-fasioned fixed benches in ranks lined with high bar-like stools. this allows water supplies to the benches to facilitates biology experiments, which mostly involve washing things. it still retains old-fashioned blackboards at the front of the lab.

Name: lockers
Description: generic grey steel lockers line ever square foot of wall in this corridoor leading to its name. the only free spare are the entrances including the foot of the west stairwell.
Help: lockers allow you to store items and keep them private from others.

Name: gloomy path
Description: leads from the main school building the to out buildings and temporary wooden classrooms, affectionately knows as huts. this path leads to you home room and is not covered, meaning that a rainy start to the school day is as miserable as it gets.

Name: workshop path
Description: this path leads to the workshops of the school, which are snesibly kept separate from the main building due to the nature of dangerous materials and tools kept in them.

Name: grassy area

Description: is where classes gather prior to banding-lessons for purposes of registration, twice daily; in the morning and after lunch. for some pupils this is as long as they will stay in school each day. the room is some kind of lab, but rarely used for lessons.

Name: home store room
Description: separates the home room and the weird room labs, with access doors leading to each. there is a large selection of supplies for a variety of lessons.

Name: weird room
Description: this room is weird in that it's identical to your home room, but a perfect mirror image in its layout. this serves as the home room for the pupils with behavioral problems, who have long since been abandonded by the school based purely on their willingness to conform to the system rather than their academic abilities.

Name: art studio
Description: a large room which is light and airy to facility the creative art process. exhibits from former pupils adorn the wall, leaving little space for new submissions, unless they are deemed better than those already existing.

Name: swimming pool
Description: a place of dread; while simming is a fun pastime for most kids at school it becomes a funless lesson in a freezing unheated outdoor pool that is over chlorinated and full of bullys who are angry that they can't swim.

Name: swimming changing room
Description: basic at best; the building is a wooden hut with no windows for privacy which leads to the room being very dimley lit and unnerving. it is also unheated and drafty; you are expected to get naked in here.

Conditions.FailResponse: the gate to the swimming pool is locked from the other side.

Name: west path
Description: the east path leads round the back of the school past the library, connecting the huts to the school playing fields.

Name: sewing room
Description: the most tranquil room in the entire school. there is nothing to do here except needle point in near silence, like a form of meditation it relaxes even the harshest bully who tries it.
Help: the sewing room is a great place to repair clothes.

Name: cooking room
Description: lined with worktops, sinks and half as many ovens. there is an enormous industrial sized fridge in the corner.
Help: overs make things hot and frieges make things cold.

Name: french room
Description: les murs sont couverts d'affiches évoquant la culture française stéréotypée ainsi que des phrases sans fin et des exemples de situation de la langue française. rien n'est en anglais ici.
Help: je ne comprends pas.

Name: german room
Description: die wände sind mit plakaten bedeckt, die auch stereotype französische kultur vorgeben, und endlose satz- und situationsbeispiele der deutschen sprache. hier ist nichts auf englisch.
Help: ich verstehe nicht.

Name: audio lab
Description: like a classroom that was high tech in the 1970s. instead of desks it is filled with ranks of partitioned booths each containing a pair of uncomfortable pre-war looking headphones and an open reel tape desk made from bakelite.

Name: maths room
Description: there are no posters on the walls here - maths related posts woulkd look too childish here, instead the walls are bare anbd uninviting.

Name: english language
Description: the walls are covered with information about the correct use of punctiation, margins, case, tense, nouns, verbs,  similies, metaphors and onomatopoeias yet strangely nothing of swear words - something that exists in equal measures in the real world.
Help: swearing will get you an immediate detention in any part of the school, but if used grammatically correctly here you might get away with it.

Conditions.PassResponse: you pluck up all your courage, step onto the open window sill and leap forward. you grab your nose as you plummet earthward and splash into the swimming pool.
Conditions.FailResponse: you look out the open window at the swimming pool below, with its murky green water and think better of it.

Name: english literature
Description: the walls are covered with posters of shakespeare, keats, dickens, orwell, eliot, chaucer, tolkien and wordsworth. here are you expected to forget everything you learned about modern english language next door and appreacite an unrecognisabl;e language from centuries ago.
Help: to be, or not to be?

Name: metal workshop
Description: a large room full of lathes and pillar drills, along with surrounding benches with rows of vices; in the corner there is a furnaces for heating metal to extremely dangerous levels complete with a bucket for quenching and case hardning.
Help: the metal workshop is a great place for working metals of all types.

Name: wood workshop
Description: the wood workshop is large and full of work benches and metal cabinets which house a variety of very sharp tools, all kept under lock and key by the teacher. the air smells of sawdust and treatment oils.

Name: back street
Description: a narrow but busy road, it is frequented by a large preportion on the pupils who attend the shcool; those who live to the west for daily access and other who visit the local shops during lunch break. there are no consesions for pupil safety here, no crossing or traffic calming.

Name: news agent
Description: a misnomer of a shop, although it sells news papers it sells just about everything from magazine, snacks, groceries and school supplies. no more than four pupils are allowed in at any time to reduce the chances of theivery.
Help: being located opposite a school it sells plenty of items that would be helpful during a normal schoolday.

Name: typing pool
Description: TODO

Name: poker den
Description: a spare classroom that rarely sees academic use, it has plenty of seating and desks which go unused and are ideal for lunch time poker games. although seedy in nature playing poker is not frowned upon by the faculty.
Help: healthy profits can be made by playing the odds.

Name: north street
Description: an eclectic collection of detached and semi-detached houses line each side of the street, their value would increase greatly if there weren't thousands of school kids traipsing past twice daily.

Conditions.FailResponse: mr broom prevents you from going any further, he shouts "vehicular access only! don't you know pedestrians and vehicles don't mix?" before going about his other business.

Name: main road
Description: it is the main road through the town and runs east/west with two lanes of traffic in each direction, intersecting the school street at a large traffic light controlled junction. due to the volume of traffic the only way across is via a pedestrian bridge.

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: you climb the dog-leg steps of the blue bridge and walk across to the middle of the bridge's span.

Name: blue bridge
Description: you are in the middle of the span of a steel pedestrian bridge across the main road, named for its colour. it is safe from traffic here.

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: you cross the remainder of the bridge and climb down the dog-leg steps on the north side.
you cross the remainder of the bridge and climb down the dog-leg steps on the south side.

Name: grassy knoll
Description: traffic races past to the south and houses line the streets to the north accompanied by a row of shops.
Help: there is no lone shooter here

Actions.UnconditionalResponse: you cross the street and enter the chinese takeaway.

Name: chinese takeaway
Description: affectionately known as the 'chippy' the takeaway restaurant is adorned with chinese decore.

Name: computer room
Description: despite sounding high-tech the school can only afford a single computer; a commodire pet, which is mostly off limits to pupils. it is possible to connect the pet to another computer elsewhere in the world via a phone line using called a modem with an accoustic coupler, but this is isn't taught in the computer room.

Name: first aid room
Description: small but well stocked with medial supplies. it smells of antiseptic and there is a single bed in the corner, this is the only place in the entire school where you are authorised to lay down.
Help: if you need to vomit, this is the best place to do it.

Name: caretaker's office
Description: an office by name only and moreover an extension of the store room. items are scattered accross the room piled high and stacked deep. although there is a desk is is covered by ring binders of inventories maintenance instructions and schedules.

Name: car park
Description: filled with an assortment of cars ranging from teacher's classics, the head master's modern luxury saloon and the starter-cars of the eldest and richest sixth formers.

Conditions.FailResponse: all the minibus doors are locked.

Name: staff room
Description: the only place in the school where you can find armchairs and sofas, although the quality of them is more line with a care home. there is a kitchenette to meet teacher's dietry needs and the air is thick with cigarette smoke.

Name: hall corridor
Description: runs the length of the assembly hall and it most commonly used to que for the gym or hall. sometimes pupils will be ejected from assemblies and made to stand in the hall corridor, although this less of a punishment than attending assemblies.

Name: north woods
Description: a small haven from the rest of the school. the trees here provide a dense canopy of leaves which prevents any sun from penetrating and offers seculusion whent he deciduous trees have leaves.

Name: west woods
Description: the west woods is a small haven from the rest of the school. the trees here provide a dense canopy of leaves which prevents anything from growning on the ground, as a result the soil is very loose here.
Help: loose soil is easy to dig.

Name: south woods
Description: a small haven from the rest of the school. the trees here are small and dense with bushes and shrubs creating a maze of small pathways in which to evade capture from teachers and pupils alike.

Name: back gate
Description: a pedestrian-only entrace to the school, it is a large rusty metal gate flanked by matching metal railing to supposidly keep people out but more likely pupils in.

Name: history room
Description: the walls are adorned with stock picture of british kings and queens however not of the lessons ever focus on this part of history. other posters highlight the current ciriculum of crop rotation in the 14th century so pointless to anyone who isn't going to become a farmer.
Help: those who do not learn history are doomed to repeat it.

Name: geography room
Description: unsurprisingly the walls are covered with maps; world maps, teraing maps, geo-political maps, topological maps and geographical features such as ox-bow lakes and volcanoes.
Help: ox-bow lake and volcano knowledge won't help you as an adult but map reading will yield dividends immediately, like finding yuour way around the school.

Name: drama room
Description: full of chairs without desks or benches and a few oversized props such as trees and shrubs. it smells like "back stage" here.

Conditions.PassResponse: you sneak into the drama cupboard in a dramatic way.
Conditions.FailResponse: the drama cupboard is locked.

Name: drama cupboard
Description: full of small props for the school plays and a wide variety of costumes. if you've ever wanted to be a roman centurion or ghost this is the place to be.
Help: drama costumes allow actors to become other people, albeit as part of a subterfuge.
